item.title: Jail and unjail somebody make my unjail command work for my jail command
item.dc:creator: @LKCTheReturn LKCTheReturn
item.description:
@LKCTheReturn wrote:

Hmm, Why don’t you just make a Boolean

I am not as good as I use to be but maybe a code like
Declare

Public Boolean Jailed = false;

And maybe have a code like

If Player name == (“lkc”);
then;
Jailed = True;
TeleTox = 3322
TeleToY = 332
else;
Jailed = False ;

That was just an example so whatever you do don’t add it lol

item.title: Jail and unjail somebody make my unjail command work for my jail command
item.dc:creator: @blacksabath blacksabath
item.description:
@blacksabath wrote:

if(command.startsWith(“jail”) && playerRights >= 1) {
String name = command.substring(9);
int player = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name);
client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[player];
int time = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(5, 8));
try {
p.toX = 2933;
p.toY = 3285;
p.jailTimer = time * 120;
p.sM(“You’ve been jailed for “+time+” minutes”);
p.sM(“If you feel that you have been jailed for a wrong reason…”);
p.sM("…talk to an Administrator unless one has jailed you.");
} catch(Exception e) {
sM(“You typed incorrectly, use as ::jail ### PlayerName”);
}
}
all see this command can anybody make a command for unjail for this so i can get rid of jailtimer

heres my unjail command
if (command.startsWith(“unjail”) && playerRights >= 2) {
try {
String otherPName = command.substring(7);
int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);
int time = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(5, 8));
if (otherPIndex != -1) {
client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];
p.toX = 2855;
p.toY = 3338;
p.jailTimer = time * 0;
p.action = 0;
p.jailTimer = time * 0;
p.sM("You have been unjailed by " + playerName);
sM (“You have unjailed “+p.playerName+”.”);
checkDupe();
} else {
sM(“The name doesnt exist.”);
}
} catch (Exception e) {
sM(“Try entering a name you want to unjail…”);
}
}
